Markus,

If at all possible, you'll probably want to create your own RobotsPolicy 
subclass, rather than change/extend RobotsTxt.

The RobotsPolicy classes are what are selected (or specified by class 
name) in the crawler configuration XML.

A useful example might be the CustomRobotsPolicy class. Intended to be 
used as an 'overlay' for specific domains, it allows an alternate 
hand-crafted robots.txt to be specified - either as an inline string in 
your crawler XML, or as a path ("ConfigPath") relative to the job 
directory. (That's similar to the two options for specifying initial 
seeds, one commented-out, in the example CXML.)

- Gordon
